result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Gary Kinder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived. Court ordered all costs and surcharges that can not be waived to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing October 1, 2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy Gary Kinder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Leroy Gary Kinder in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Sentencing proceeded.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived.  Court ordered all costs and surcharges that can not be waived to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing October 1, 2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Leroy Gary Kinder in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leroy Gary Kinder in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Leroy Gary Kinder in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
